name: rosário.dos.pretos
description:
#11 - streets of salvador

built in 1685

in the back of the church there is an old slave cemetery. preserving its history linked to the black people, the liturgy of the services makes use of music inspired by the candomblé. it is an example of syncretism, with the blessing tuesday, when candomblé instruments are used to accompany the mass. on the commemorative dates of santa bárbara and Iansã the church is the focal point of the festivities.

the dynamics of salvador the first capital of brazil, its architectural structures and miscegenated people are portrayed in photos and videos from the perspective of those who were raised there.

the blackest city outside africa, salvador is the portrait of all the inequality generated by a slave colony.

salvador - bahia - brazil - 2015
